title: Bern
summary: Bern (Swiss Standard German: [bɛrn] (listen); Alemannic German: Bärn [b̥æːrn]) or Berne (French: [bɛʁn] (listen); Arpitan: Bèrna [ˈbɛʁna] (listen); Italian: Berna [ˈbɛrna]; Romansh: Berna [ˈbɛrnɐ] (listen)) is the de facto capital of Switzerland, referred to by the Swiss as their "federal city" (in German: Bundesstadt, French: ville fédérale, and Italian: città federale).[4][note 1] With a population of about 144,000 (as of 2020), Bern is the fifth-most populous city in Switzerland.[5] The Bern agglomeration, which includes 36 municipalities, had a population of 406,900 in 2014.[6] The metropolitan area had a population of 660,000 in 2000.[7]
